We have a 2 year old and were nervous about this. With the A-frame, the 2nd floor has limited head space surrounding the stairs so you sort of have to lean as you’re walking across the loft near the stairwell opening, and the floor is narrow right there. A rail up there would be a helpful safety feature for this property.

We didn't cook so can't speak to the kitchen's set up, but a glance through the cabinets showed it was well stocked with the usual kitchen-stuff. I appreciated the very nice coffeemaker and new bag of coffee. Wifi worked really well and we were able to get to and from where we needed to be easily. The interior is clean and nicely decorated. Really charming!
Couple of things for future guests. There's a very loud street a short distance from the home and you can hear it from inside. While the description says 6 guests, I think four max is comfortable. The futon in the living room is really uncomfortable; I don't recommend sleeping on it. There's a queen bed and two twin beds upstairs though. The stairs leading upstairs are really steep, but have motion lighting that helps at night.
Overall, it was a great place to stay. Really unique and a pretty fun experience. I'd stay there again.

I wanted four things specifically:
-To see the stars
-To be in the mountains
-Have a fire (outside/inside or both)
-A hot tub
This checked every box and then some! Lida was super helpful is providing directions and making sure we were prepared and knew what to expect weather wise, as it had snowed up there. We arrived to a pristinely clean cabin, fire already going and delicious cookies.
The cabin has everything you need to feel cozy and at home. The views are absolutely stunning. Plenty of space. We pretty much stayed on the main floor. There’s 4 rooms upstairs and a bathroom with a tub. Washer and dryer is upstairs as well. Linens are all clean and fresh.
The main level has a bathroom and walk-in shower, huge kitchen with a really nice stove and utensils and/or all the bakeware/cookware you could possibly image, huge living room with wood burning stove, TV, desk, two couches, two recliners and 2 HUGE tables AND the MOST comfortable bed ever (for anyone who might not be able to do the stairs). It’s an excellent cabin for families! We stayed downstairs pretty much the entire time, because we have a blind dog and a paralyzed dog, so it was just easier. And frankly, it was cozy.
Lida was also kind enough to let us do a later check out since we got in a little later on the first day. She was just incredibly friendly and accommodating. I really couldn’t recommend this place more highly. 5 stars all around!! We will DEFINITELY be back again!
